description:
Amazing Spaces: Series 5

Technology Documentary hosted by George Clarke, published by Channel 4 in 2015 - English narration 
http://docuwiki.net/images/8/81/Amazing-Spaces-Series-5-Cover.jpg

Information
------------------------------

George Clarke's Amazing Spaces: Series 5
George Clarke explores the extraordinary world of small builds, where people turn tiny spaces into the most incredible places to live, work and play. He even tries making a few of his own.


1)  Part 1 
George begins by meeting a father and son building an ambitious clifftop retreat and a young architect embarking on his first commission - a garden pavilion for his Gran. Master craftsman Will Hardie sets out to transform the humble beach hut into the most unlikely of holiday getaways, and in Germany, George visits a modern house in a medieval town.

2)  Part 2 
George meets a man building a campervan out of CDs and old vinyl records. There's also a single dad making a home on the water for him and his sons out of an oil rig escape pod.

3)  Part 3 
George meets a young man looking on an internet dating site for a shipmate to help turn an old boat into a home. There's also a cricket-mad granddad building a mini pavilion in his garden.

4)  Part 4 
George meets a man planning to build Margate's first Victorian bathing machine in more than 100 years, and a coma survivor who proves he has a sense of humour by transforming a hearse into a family camper van. The presenter also visits a woman who has turned her narrowboat home into a floating bookshop, and in Germany he sees a lifeguard tower straight out of a 1950s sci-fi comic.

5)  Part 5 
George visits a river barge conversion, an ingenious swimming pool restoration and a futuristic lakeside house in Germany

6)  Part 6 
George meets a couple transforming their garden air-raid shelters. There's also 12-year-old Guinnie, who hopes to create the ultimate party shed, and some luxury beach houses.

7)  Part 7 
George meets a couple so desperate to get on the housing ladder that they're making their own home out of scrap. And there's drama in the workshop with the beach hut project.

8)  Part 8 
George and Will's floating beach hut goes to sea. There's also a festival campervan made from an American school bus and a family home in Germany built in an old grain silo.
